# eslint/no-delete-var <Badge type="info" text="Correctness" />

<div class="rule-meta">
<Alert class="default-on" type="success">
<span class="emoji">âœ…</span> This rule is turned on by default.
</Alert>
</div>

### What it does

The purpose of the `delete` operator is to remove a property from an
object.

### Why is this bad?

Using the `delete` operator on a variable might lead to unexpected
behavior.

### Example

Examples of **incorrect** code for this rule:

```javascript
var x;
delete x;
```

- [Rule Source](https://github.com/oxc-project/oxc/blob/25ddb3519289dfe2a51e53b9b0c355d8ad950bbc/crates/oxc_linter/src/rules/eslint/no_delete_var.rs)
